image.altText: James Stevens consoled after conceding defeat

props.synopsis: After hitting "rock bottom" at the federal election, the SA Liberals will be hoping the only way from here is up, writes state political reporter Leah MacLennan.

title.children: Will the federal election results be replicated at next year's SA contest?

image.altText: A group of women holding signs at a protest.

props.synopsis: Rallies across Australian cities are taking place to demand more action on violence against women. Victim-survivors are frustrated and calling on the government to act.

title.children: Frustrated protesters demand more government action to protect women

image.altText: Port Adelaide and Adelaide players fight for the football

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide and Adelaide get the 57th Showdown off to a flyer in Adelaide as the Suns attempt to build a lead against the Bulldogs in Darwin. Follow live.

title.children: Crows and Power exchange blows in tense Showdown, Suns star returns after scary head knock

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HT: Gold Coast 6.8 (44) leads Western Bulldogs 5.7 (37)

image.altText: A man stands in front of several black plastic trays piled on top of each other.

props.synopsis: A Coffin Bay oyster farmer and his recycling team have spent weeks shredding waste plastic from producers on the NSW coast in the hopes of boosting the industry's recycling.

title.children: Shredder helps recycle 'half a footy field' of plastic from oyster farms

image.altText: A sheep eating hay looking towards the camera, standing in a dry paddock with other sheep

props.synopsis: Farmers running out of feed and water are being forced to sell livestock in huge numbers as drought conditions roll on in southern Australia.

title.children: No feed, no water and no money — drought smashes farmers on all fronts

image.altText: A man with a beard stands in front of a stone facade.

props.synopsis: An Iranian refugee has lost a court battle against the federal government for mental health injuries caused by five years of immigration detention.

title.children: Refugee loses court battle over mental injuries caused by immigration detention

image.altText: A man crouches in shallow water with a fish in his hands which he is lowering into the water

props.synopsis: They may be river fish, but a truckload of Murray cod will make their new home in a volcanic crater to fight pests and attract tourists.

title.children: The powerful fish that could boost tourism and kill a reviled pest

image.altText: Crime scene tape outside a home.

props.synopsis: A woman dies in hospital after she was stabbed in the chest, with police arresting and charging another woman at the scene at Elizabeth East in Adelaide.

title.children: Murder charge laid after woman stabbed in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A sign saying CORONERS COURT on a modern sandstone building

props.synopsis: The SA Deputy State Coroner says that while in prison on charges of affray and property damages, the 18-year-old was "physically safe from taking his own life".

title.children: Teen should have had 'psychotic state treated' before being bailed, coroner finds

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: The TV show has adults talking or, shall we say, anxious. But what do young people think about it?

title.children: 'It's like real life': Teens divided over showing Adolescence in schools

image.altText: A dead penguin lays on a beach.

props.synopsis: The Department of Environment and Water said it was unclear at this stage if new penguin deaths on the Eyre Peninsula were linked to the ongoing algal bloom across South Australia.

title.children: Dead little penguins washed up on multiple Eyre Peninsula beaches

image.altText: man shearing a sheep and the sheep looking to camera

props.synopsis: Australian wool production is forecast to reach its lowest level since the early 1900s, forcing skilled shearers to seek work interstate, overseas or leave the industry entirely.

title.children: Shearers struggle for work as wool production hits century low

image.altText: Container ships docked at Port Botany.

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers struggling with drought need livestock feed, but Australian shipping laws make it unaffordable for Australian sea freight to reach them.

title.children: 'Cheaper to ship to China' than send WA grain to drought-hit farmers

image.altText: A woman wearing a red singlet holds a basketball above her head and looks to pass. A defender stands in front with arm raised.

props.synopsis: Adelaide will continue in the Women's National Basketball League (WNBL) after the league's new owners today announced a partnership with the SA government to keep the team alive.

title.children: Adelaide's WNBL team saved by SA government but no guarantees on 'Lightning' name

image.altText: Liberal candidate Tom Venning with a campaign car.

props.synopsis: ABC election analyst Antony Green says, depending on preferences, an electoral battle in the seat of Grey could be "bad news" for the Liberals — but candidate Tom Venning remains confident of retaining the seat for the party.

title.children: Liberals at risk of losing one of their last two SA seats

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two Victorian men who attempted to import more than 100 kilograms of cocaine worth $17 million into South Australia have had their jail terms more than doubled on appeal.

title.children: Jail term doubled for 'muppets' involved in 100kg cocaine import attempt

image.altText: A clear blue sky over paddocks in Auburn, SA

props.synopsis: As South Australia and Victoria continue to face drought and unseasonable heat, there has been a notable absence of major rain systems. So, what's going on?

title.children: Rainfall maps offer ominous insight where Australia's climate is headed

image.altText: a mother and daughter on a sunny day standing in front of a red and yellow car, holding a sausage dog.

props.synopsis: When Trini Hale first participated in the Shitbox Rally in 2023, she had no way of knowing she would be diagnosed with kidney cancer and rallying for herself two years later.

title.children: Mother and daughter do Lunchbox Rally road trip after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A painting of an old wooden sailing ship

props.synopsis: In 1857, the Koning Willem de Tweede sank off SA's south-east coast, and researchers are now confident they have found it.

title.children: Shipwreck lost for nearly 170 years finally found off SA coast

image.altText: A black and white photo showing the old school house from the side with its gothic windows and door visible and tin roof

props.synopsis: Sydney couple Mon Berger and Charlie Tutty bought a rundown 19th-century schoolhouse more than 1,000 kilometres away, with a dream to revive, restore and one day retire to the heritage-listed property.

title.children: Old schoolhouse restoration transforms piece of history in Adelaide Hills

image.altText: new pope leo dressed in white robes raises his hands to deliver mass to cardinals

props.synopsis: Addressing the cardinals in English, he said "you have called me to carry the cross and to be blessed" and asked for their help to spread the Catholic faith.

title.children: New Pope Leo XIV vows to bring light to the world's 'dark nights'

image.altText: A sign reading Port Augusta Prison Smoke Free Environmen outside a car park and brown building

props.synopsis: A new section of Port Augusta Prison had barriers that were constructed wide enough that a prisoner could slip through. The design flaw was fixed before the unit opened.

title.children: New SA prison unit had gaps 'large enough for a prisoner to squeeze through'

image.altText: A Philippine Navy AW159 helicopter with the the HMAS Sydney in the background.

props.synopsis: China's Foreign Ministry sharply criticises Australia after joint drills in the South China Sea with the US and the Philippines, accusing all three nations of trying to "create trouble."

title.children: China criticises Australia over joint exercises in South China Sea

image.altText: A gecko peeks out of the palm of someone's hands.

props.synopsis: New Caledonia's giant geckos are the latest sensation in the global pet trade. But conservationists warn their social media-fuelled popularity is putting the endangered species at risk.

title.children: The online gecko craze turning into a conservation nightmare

image.altText: Police officers in uniform patrolling a street.

props.synopsis: A former employee of Tasmania's notorious Ashley Youth Detention Centre has been arrested over alleged serious sexual offences, including child sexual abuse, while he was working at the centre.

title.children: Fomer employee of notorious Tasmanian children's prison charged over alleged abuse

image.altText: A group of 8 people are standing in front of a table where two agreements are held up. they are standing outside

props.synopsis: A regional town in New South Wales is making history with a "momentous" partnership that embeds Closing the Gap targets into local government processes for the first time.

title.children: 'Historic' deal embeds Indigenous decision-making in local council

image.altText: An example ballot paper being filled out

props.synopsis: The results of a local council election in the City of Whittlesea in Melbourne's north have been voided, after suspicious votes were detected by authorities.

title.children: Melbourne council election result voided after suspected fraud

image.altText: Sheikh Wesam Charkawi, The Muslim Vote convener

props.synopsis: Labor maintained their key seats in Western Sydney, but it was not without a fight.

title.children: 'No question' Gaza played role in Western Sydney seats swing

image.altText: Painting of black and white figure suspended in air.

props.synopsis: Women's labour is in the spotlight in Brisbane artist Julie Fragar's portrait Flagship Mother Multiverse (Justene), which has won the $100,000 Archibald Prize.

title.children: Julie Fragar wins $100,000 Archibald Prize for portrait of fellow artist

image.altText: Stuart MacGill wearing a suit outside court

props.synopsis: Former Australian cricketer Stuart MacGill avoids jail after being found guilty of taking part in the supply of cocaine in Sydney.

title.children: Retired cricketer sentenced over 'indispensable role' in $330k drug deal

image.altText: Raghe Mohammed Abdi smiles a the camera. He wears a school uniform consisting of a maroon jacket and tie, and a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Raghe Mohamed Abdi murdered two people before he was shot and killed by police on the Logan Motorway.

title.children: Coroner unable to determine 'radicalised' man's motive for killing elderly couple

image.altText: Bill Gates with a tight-lipped smile

props.synopsis: Bill Gates aims to donate $US200 billion to his foundation in 20 years time, and calls out Elon Musk for "killing the world's poorest children".

title.children: Gates pledges to donate 99pc of fortune, accuses Musk of harming world's poorest

image.altText: Cassius montage

props.synopsis: A memorial plaque for Cassius Turvey in his community of Midland, east of Perth, sits as an enduring reminder of the legacy he left behind: "gentle giant", "huggable teddy bear", and a "young leader".

title.children: Big in stature, with even bigger heart, Cassius's death shocked nation

image.altText: A man in a brightly-coloured swimming cap and rash vest bodysurfs a wave.

props.synopsis: The world's best bodysurfers flocked to the Sunshine Coast to push the limits of the sport. Among them was Australian Olympic legend Susie O'Neill.

title.children: Bodysurfing world titles take simple pastime to next level
